ABOUT

Who are we?
We are a Toastmasters club.
You can call us an oratory hub.
Once every week,
We gather to speak
And afterwards grab some grub.

What are we like?
Students, staff, and alumni,
A monk, a priest and a rabbi,
You needn’t fear
We’ve got them all here
So you’ll fit right in when you come by

Interested? Come to our meetings or send us an email (info.varistytoastmasters@gmail.com). Join us on Facebook, where you can get up-to-date information about the club and chat with a current member.

FAQ

When and where do you meet?

We meet every Wednesday from 6pm to 8pm. Meetings are currently held: .

Meetings generally don't happen for few weeks around Christmas. If there's nothing on posted here or on our facebook page, send us an email to find out what's going on.

How much does it cost to join?

If you're new, it's $. After that, it's $ per semester. Being a guest is free though. Further information is on the Membership section of this website.

What's the difference between Biztalk and Varsity?

Varsity is Auckland University's original Toastmasters club. We were so popular, Biztalk had to be created to ensure everyone had a chance to speak. Biztalk has its meetings on Monday and they take themselves very seriously

Why should I join this club?

Because we're fast and loose. If you're interested in listening to some squares talk about conflict resoltuion in the work place or whatever, look elsewhere. Sometimes we forget who was meant to be evaluating. Doesn't matter. Improvise. Adapt. Overcome.

What does 'Varsity' mean?

You uncultured swine! It refers to university.

I'm not a student. Can I still join?

Yes.
